fields.description:
When adding revisions to a review, Crucible does not seem to allow to include the revision that corresponds to a metadata change in the svn repository. The checkbox is disabled and cannot be included in the set of revisions on the review.
If using the remote API though, the same revision can be added to a review. The API call via curl was:
{noformat}
curl --data @reviewrevision.txt -u <FECRU Username>:<FECRU Password> http://Host:Port/rest-service/reviews-v1/{ReviewId}/reviewitems/revisions -H "Content-Type:application/xml"
{noformat}
where {{reviewrevision.txt}} is:
{noformat}
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>
<revisions>
    <revisionData>
        <rev>rev1</rev>
        <rev>rev2</rev>
        <source><repo></source>
        <path>/filename.txt</path>
    </revisionData>
</revisions>
{noformat}
fields.summary: inconsistency between UI and API for dealing with svn metadata

fields.description:
I would like the ability to exclude a repository or exclude a #pattern in Fisheye from the smart commits feature.  Some developers include #comment in SVN comments which triggers a Fisheye smart commits error e-mail.  Below is an example of the error.  

FishEye was unable to execute the transition "comment" on the issue JIRA-0001 because JIRA responded with the following error: No transitions for issue JIRA-0001 (Open) matched the command 'comment'
fields.summary: Ability to opt a single repository or #pattern out of smart commits

fields.description:
In fisheye, it is possible to navigate around the SVN source using the left folder list. When you click on the folder appearing in the left hand side list, we are able to view the sub folders of the clicked folder in the middle of the screen. 
There are two different behavior that we have observed for watching a folder.
If you try to watch a folder by clicking the folder from the left hand side list and watch then it is actually not watching the particular folder that has been clicked but watches the entire repository. Please refer FromLeftList.png attached scrrenshot. You can see that I clicked on the 'main' folder at the left hand side list but when I am trying to watch the 'main' folder, it is showing in the tool tip that the entire repository will be watched and not the only selected folder.
However, If you try to watch a folder by clicking the folder from the list available in the center of the screen and watch then it is actually watching the particular folder that has been clicked. Please refer FromCenterList.png attached scrrenshot. You can see that I clicked on the 'main' folder from the Center list and when I am trying to watch the 'main' folder, it is showing in the tool tip that the particular folder will be watched. This is correct behavior.
Please investigate at your end and let us know if the behavior is a known issue.
fields.summary: Watch feature doesn't update its target when navigating source using left folder list

fields.description:
Errors are thrown from navBuilder on file path search result page:


{noformat}
2012-09-17 04:24:07,393 INFO  [btpool0-837 ] fisheye.app TotalityFilter-logExceptionDetails - Exception "javax.el.ELException: Problems calling function 'nav:browseDiff'" (javax.servlet.ServletException) while processing "/WEB-INF/jsp/search/search.jsp" (Referer:"http://crucible.dev.sabre.com:8080/cru/apdgms-22/")
javax.servlet.ServletException: javax.el.ELException: Problems calling function 'nav:browseDiff'
{noformat}

This could be occurring when a repo has not been fully imported. ie. start-rev set and initial-import set to none.

To workaround this in the meantime, try setting initial-import config to: "Import without tag information". This can be done on each repository via:
Repositories --> <repo name> --> SCM Details --> Initial Import --> "Import without tag information" .
Especially try this for the repo being referred to in your error logs.

Then perform a re-index when prompted and try the search again.
fields.summary: Exception "javax.el.ELException: Problems calling function 'nav:browseDiff'"

fields.description:
h5. Steps to reproduce.

# Connect a JIRA project to another project's  FishEye repository using *configure links*, in JIRA Administration screen, screenshot "applink.png".
# Go to FishEye and browse to the activity of the connected repository. JIRA project Links will have no clickable URL, only the name of the issue as shown in the screenshot "unlinkedissues.png"

h5. Potential workaround

In FishEye administration, add the JIRA project to the repository links, screenshot "fisheyeadmin.png". 

h5. User expectation

As a user, linking the JIRA project should be enough to link the JIRA project to the FishEye repository, without the need to go again to the FishEye administration and link the repository back to the JIRA project.
fields.summary: Connected Project to FishEye repository doesn't  have clickable JIRA issue links in FishEye Activity

When we click the link we expect the UI load and make the comment visible, but in many cases, because the comment is outside the "changeset" the comment is not visible, I have to change the view to see the entire file.

fields.description:
FishEye should provide a feedback/message when viewing an empty commit to clarify the situation. 
Users might think that FishEye is having problem retrieving the commit due to the infinite loading animation here: 

https://atlaseye.atlassian.com/changelog/jira-git?cs=1d19dcbd0ce76c0d37ad9a603c62dd13fc2b729a

While it is meaningless for the developer doing the commit to see changes in FishEye, it would save the time and effort for other developers.
fields.summary: Provide feedback/message when viewing an empty commit (empty diff)

fields.description:
Possibly also improve on the Error messaging in the logs if a re-index is in fact required.

If Fisheye license is disabled for some reason, repository indexing halts and following message is displayed:
{quote}
Failed to start repository <Repository Name>: Problem loading repository '<Repository Name>' - Current repository index for "<Repository Name>" is not compatible with your license, please re-index.
{quote}
Logs report:
{noformat}
2012-09-10 14:55:00,819 WARN  [main ] fisheye.app DefaultRepositoryManager-runRepositories - Problem starting repository
com.cenqua.fisheye.config.ConfigException: Current repository index for "<Repository Name>" is not compatible with your license, please re-index
    at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.BaseRepositoryScanner.validateIndexingFeatures(BaseRepositoryScanner.java:359)
    at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.BaseRepositoryScanner.determineIndexingFeatures(BaseRepositoryScanner.java:345)
    at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.BaseRepositoryScanner.start(BaseRepositoryScanner.java:494)
{noformat}

This messaging could be more intutive for customers to understand what's causing the problem, such as "License invalid or Disabled".
With the current implementation, it can be very misleading.
fields.summary: Investigate why FishEye Repositories require a re-index when FishEye is disabled

fields.description:
The installation (and thus maintenance) of FishEye/Crucible is far different from other Atlassian products. Please make an installer similar to the other products.

– Edit –
 For more clarity this ticket has been broken down in 2 different tickets
 - -FE-5186- to track the Windows installer
 - FE-5185 to track the Linux installer

As of FishEye/Crucible 3.4 it is now possible to install FishEye and Crucible on Windows via a binary installer.

The issue does not seem to be browser specific, as it has been reported on Chrome, IE and FireFox.

Found this Jetty bug:
http://jira.codehaus.org/browse/JETTY-1142

Smart Commits interpret '#' within a word

fields.description:
When "Force Lowercase Username" is enabled in FishEye, LDAP user with different case will be created in FishEye. Even though the uppercase users are shown as Deleted, it can still be used during create review: CRUC-6210

The uppercase users should be merged with the lowercase username when the setting "Force Lowercase Username" is enabled.

*Workaround*
Merge the user from the SQL script in this [KB|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHKB/Users+appear+deleted+after+upgrading+to+FishEye+2.7.X]
fields.summary: Duplicate LDAP user after enabling "Force Lowercase Username"

fields.description:
This affects the area of smart commits and web hooks and possibly other parts of the code as well.

When you try to activate one of the features above, you easily get the following errors:

"An error occurred: com.mysql.jdbc.exceptions.jdbc4.MySQLSyntaxErrorException: Table 'fecru.AO_8219D4_COMMIT_HOOK_CONFIG' doesn't exist"

"com.mysql.jdbc.exceptions.jdbc4.MySQLSyntaxErrorException: Table 'fecru.AO_B434B9_WEB_HOOK' doesn't exist
Table 'fecru.AO_B434B9_WEB_HOOK' doesn't exist"


This is caused by the fact that these tables were created with small letters but are are accessed with capital letters. This request is to ensure that table creation code and table access codes use a consistent syntax when accessing the database.
fields.summary: Inconsistent capitalization of database tables

fields.description:
We currently have 81 mercurial repositories and 3 cvs repositories. We set up the repos with all default values and found the load average on the box went very high. After researching, this is due to the fact that fisheye is scanning the repos non-stop (1 after another).

What I would like to see would be a way to choose a smart scheduler to schedule updates of the repositories. Something that could ramp up scanning (say after a commit is seen it goes back to scanning every 60 s). But after each scan in which nothing changes, it adds 30 seconds to the next scan up to a minimum threshold say 10 minutes (configurable). That way active projects would be scanning every 60 seconds and inactive projects and night-time everything would only scan every 10 minutes. This would significantly lower the load on our server.
fields.summary: Add smarter scanning scheduler rather than simple timer.

fields.description:
This documentation: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Migrating+to+MySQL+Enterprise+Server
does not have information about case sensitive setting in MySQL: http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.0/en/identifier-case-sensitivity.html

Migrating the MySQL database from one server to another server with mysqldump has cause the following error:
{noformat}
* Select Smart Commits, check all options and click Apply

An error occurred: com.mysql.jdbc.exceptions.jdbc4.MySQLSyntaxErrorException: Table 'fecru.AO_8219D4_COMMIT_HOOK_CONFIG' doesn't exist 

* Select Web Hooks
    com.mysql.jdbc.exceptions.jdbc4.MySQLSyntaxErrorException: Table 'fecru.AO_B434B9_WEB_HOOK' doesn't exist
    Table 'fecru.AO_B434B9_WEB_HOOK' doesn't exist
{noformat}

The *workaround* is either setting case insensitive setting {{lower_case_table_names=2}} in MySQL server or renaming the tables to lowercase manually.

The documentation should have additional steps to check on the case sensitive setting in MySQL server.
fields.summary: Update on Migrating to MySQL Enterprise Server documentation

fields.description:
When a perforce commit is amended to add a job id, the job ID is not properly recognised by a partial re-index.

Steps to reproduce:
1. create a JIRA issue which is linked to a P4 job ID using the JFP's perforce integration
2. submit a perforce changeset with no attached job id's
3. wait for fisheye to index the changeset
4. edit the changeset in perforce to add the job id
5. perform a partial re-index of a changeset range which includes the amended changeset

The perforce job ID will be visible when directly viewing the changeset in fisheye, but will not be returned by the REST endpoint, for example:
http://localhost:6060/foo/rest-service-fe/changeset-v1/listChangesets?rep=PS&expand=changesets[-21:-1].revisions[0:29]&comment=PS-3&p4JobFixed=PS-3

The changeset will then not be visible in the source tab in JIRA.

Jobs are re-index properly when doing a full repository re-index.
fields.summary: When a perforce commit is amended to add a job id, the job ID is not picked up by a partial re-index

fields.description:
Perforce indexing does not create tag head records.

The effect of this is that labels are not shown in the branch selector.
fields.summary: Perforce labels/tags are not indexed

fields.description:
Currently, if an instance is big (100+ repos) and problems are happening because the updates are taking too long, keeping the instance too busy, the changes in the repos update period (custom value) need to be made one by one in each repo.

Would be good to have an extra tab under Admin >> Repository Settings >> Defaults, so that the default can be changed. The current default is hard coded.
fields.summary: Add a default Update Period setting and allow Admin to change it

fields.description:
When a plugin attempts to send an email notification (when a smart commit fails, say), with certain email configurations, the following exception is thrown when the email notification is processed by FishEye:

{code}
java.lang.ClassCastException: com.cenqua.crucible.notification.Notification cannot be cast to java.lang.Comparable
	at java.util.TreeMap.compare(Unknown Source)
	at java.util.TreeMap.put(Unknown Source)
	at java.util.TreeSet.add(Unknown Source)
	at java.util.AbstractCollection.addAll(Unknown Source)
	at java.util.TreeSet.addAll(Unknown Source)
	at java.util.TreeSet.<init>(Unknown Source)
	at com.cenqua.crucible.notification.batch.creators.PluginBatchCreator.getEmailSegment(PluginBatchCreator.java:50)
	at com.cenqua.crucible.notification.DefaultNotificationManager.getBatchMessage(DefaultNotificationManager.java:556)
	at com.cenqua.crucible.notification.DefaultNotificationManager.processNotification(DefaultNotificationManager.java:506)
	at com.cenqua.crucible.notification.DefaultNotificationManager.processNotifications(DefaultNotificationManager.java:362)
	at com.cenqua.crucible.notification.DefaultNotificationManager.access$200(DefaultNotificationManager.java:78)
	at com.cenqua.crucible.notification.DefaultNotificationManager$6.run(DefaultNotificationManager.java:289)
	at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Unknown Source)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask$Sync.innerRunAndReset(Unknown Source)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.runAndReset(Unknown Source)
	at java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor$ScheduledFutureTask.access$301(Unknown Source)
	at java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor$ScheduledFutureTask.run(Unknown Source)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(Unknown Source)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(Unknown Source)
{code}


This is happening because we are adding a Notification object to a TreeSet. The contract for a TreeSet is:
bq. All elements inserted into the set must implement the Comparable interface.

http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/util/TreeSet.html#TreeSet(java.util.SortedSet)
fields.summary: Email Notifications fired from plugins fail with: java.lang.ClassCastException: com.cenqua.crucible.notification.Notification cannot be cast to java.lang.Comparable

fields.description:
We would like quick control to set email notifications on users, without requiring the users to do it themselves.

Originally this started as a request to email general groups(svn-list@domain.com), but it sounds like it's easier to allow admin control.

See https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/83873/is-there-a-way-to-use-fisheye-to-send-an-e-mail-to-a-group-list for reference.
fields.summary: As a Fisheye administrator, I would like to be able set other users(or global) watches.

fields.description:
In a test SVN repo, I have made 4 commits, and changed 4 files (see attached screenshot).
When I check my individual stats, some things don't look right:
# my commits for the last week are shown as 0, when it should be 4
# my files changed for all time is shown as 8, when it should be 4
fields.summary: some stats displayed for a user are incorrect

fields.description: When visiting the FishEye/Crucible Dashboard the page title is "Username Home". With many tabs/windows this can make it hard to locate. I think it could perhaps be something like "Username Home -- AtlasEye".
fields.summary: FishEye/Crucible Dashboard should have product name in the page title

fields.description:
My browser restarted for a software update today and FishEye required me to login again. When I did so I found myself at this page:
https://atlaseye.atlassian.com/user/jbunton?ajax=true

I then received a screenful of JSON instead of a useful page :)
fields.summary: Logging in after Firefox restart gave me Javascript instead of a useful page

This list may be incomplete, as errors occurred whilst retrieving source from linked applications:
Repository confluence on https://atlaseye.atlassian.com/ failed: Error in remote call to 'atlaseye' (https://atlaseye.atlassian.com) [AbstractRestCommand{path='/rest-service-fe/changeset-v1/listChangesets/', params={expand=changesets[-11:-1].revisions[0:9], comment=CONFDEV-10202, p4JobFixed=CONFDEV-10202, rep=confluence}, methodType=GET}] : Received status code 500 (Internal Server Error)
fields.summary: 500 error received from FishEye when retrieving changesets for Source tab in JIRA

fields.description:
We're using fisheye and crucible in production mode with a MySQL database and a starter license. We now have 9 active committers.  Evidently this put us over the limit of users.  We have had several contractors leave since we first implemented FE and CR.  Those users are mapped to the admin user (which in reality, we don't use that account to commit anything).  That puts us right at our limit of 10 users as I understand it.  Please see attachments.

Why am I still getting the error that we have exceeded the limits for Starter license?  

Since we have mapped the users that are gone to an active user, we should still be within the limit...right?

Side note, also the links in the Note go to pages that cannot be found.



"To fix this you can Evaluate, Upgrade or Reconfigure your repository." the link goes to https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/tinyurl.action?urlIdentifier=3IIfD
fields.summary: Starter License - exceed limits for and indexing stopped

fields.description:
Apparently the older versions of Fisheye (2.3 and prior) had the "Recent Activity" column for all users under the "People" tab.
This was removed later due to performance reasons, as part of [this|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CRUC-3305] improvement.

It would be good to have this feature back into the application.
fields.summary: Add "Recent Activity" column back to the "People" tab.

fields.description:
the FishEye REST endpoints should possibly return both the committer and the mapped user, and then we can modify the JIRA FishEye plugin to report one or the other or potentially both.

Something to note is that you likely wont be able to get avatars for the FishEye users when youre in JIRA.
fields.summary: Jira FishEye Plugin shows commits as the SCM author, rather than the mapped FishEye user

fields.description:
We've gotten a handful of reports from customers regarding ugly looking Source/Review tabs.  From the browser error console:
{noformat}

GET https://someinstance.ondemand.com/source/static/m8s186/2static/style/concat.commonScriptAndStyleIncludes.42811ab093eb75d9de9eb0cc61c99412.cache.css 404 (Not Found) /source/:86
GET https://someinstance.ondemand.com/source/static/m8s186/2static/style/concat.style.a6fcafbacc6d6f2bc17a67eca59403dd.cache.css 404 (Not Found) /source/:19
Running
{noformat}

The current fix is to manually flush Fisheye's content cache via https://instance/source/admin/content.do which requires sysadmin.

Please add something to that automatically flushes Fisheye's cache on restart or new upgrade in OnDemand.
fields.summary: CSS issues after recent OnDemand 167 upgrade

fields.description:
The SVN folder structure (i.e. branches/, tags) isn't shown in the drop down box when the folder name isn't all in lowercase (read, uncapitalized) when using the admin checkbox "Use Built-in Symbolic Rules".

*Additionally* - Even given the symbolic rules below the "trunk" button on the UI will not correctly map to the trunk folder -- see attached image [no_equivalent_trunk.png|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/70459/no_equivalent_trunk.png].

{noformat}
<trunk regex="(Trunk|trunk)(/|$) " name="trunk" logical=""/>
<branch regex="(Branches|branches)/([^/]+)" name="${2}" logical=""/>
<tag regex="(Tags|tags)/([^/]+)" name="${2}" logical=""/></symbolic>
{noformat}
fields.summary: SVN Built-in Symbolic Rules only recognizes un-capitalized folder names - trunk, branch, tag

fields.description:
Setup Fisheye 2.8.0 and JIRA 5.1.2 with trusted authentication.
When using smart commits to update a JIRA issue, the changesets are visible in JIRA with the added comment, but the comment is not being added to the JIRA issue. The issue transition and time tracking action is not working either.

No errors in JIRA or Fisheye logs.
fields.summary: Smart Commits not working in JIRA with Fisheye integration

fields.description: The screenshots on [this|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Viewing+People%27s+Statistics] page are outdated. The "Latest Activity" and "LoC" are no longer included on this screen.

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Git

fields.description:
See attachment. The source view is not working in the latest stable Google Chrome.

It looks like it's miscalculating the viewport width, causing the source code view to float underneath the line number / commit hash / committer columns instead of next to them. If I inspect the iframe element in Chrome's Developer Tools, I find that reducing the width of the "to-box" element by 2 pixels (always seems to be 2, no matter how big the viewport) causes it to reappear.
fields.summary: Source view not working when Browser Zoom level is less than 100% in latest stable Google Chrome on Ubuntu
Inconsistent site url resolution in FE

fields.description:
The behavior I would expect when I choose the 'Force Lowercase Usernames' under the Authentication Settings is for Fisheye to normalize the usernames everywhere is sees them. 

I see under the current Users that have logged on that only the lowercase version exists which is what I expected. However when creating a review and choose to search for by name, it returns both upper and lower case versions. So which once should be chosen? I would assume the lowercase, but what if developers choose the uppercase.. What does that effect down the road?

I don't want to have to manually be mapping and remapping of developers..
fields.summary: When adding a reviewer to a new Review, the dropdown shows both upper and lower case username

fields.description:
As we take on administrating fisheye our developers have a exploding number of repositories that they add/change weekly. Currently i have added 280, and they add a 10-12 a week. What i would like to see is a tab on the Repositories Admin page that lets me at a glance see Errors in repositories. Or filter by State. 



NOTE: As an administrator of Fisheye and other Atlassian products I have found inconsistancies among searching and categorizing products/repos/etc but that is a seperate issue or future enhancements.
fields.summary: Add a tab to the Repositories Administration Page for glance of errors or states of Repositories that need action.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The Committer username to FishEye username mapping is a manual process and can be done via UI only.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a REST API call to create the user mappings.
fields.summary: As an admin, I want a REST API call to create user mappings between Committer username and FishEye username, so that I can add multiple mappings in a more efficient way

fields.description:
Currently, only user names can be mapped. Would be good if the admin could set different attributes/fields from the Users to be matched against the repository Committers.

Example: the repo committer is the user email or a number not tracked by Fisheye.

Instead of mapping the users one by one (ie. user->email), the admin could change the mapping settings from "user name" to "email" and the mapping would be automatically done.
fields.summary: Allow Admin to define What Built-in, LDAP or Crowd attribute/field will be used to Map a User to a Committer

fields.description:
Let's say the "release-1-patches" branch is tagged with "release-1-1" on Jan-01-2012, and then "newfile.C" was added later to the repository on that branch.

Doing:
{quote}{{*select revisions where (is head on "release-1-patches" and date >= 2012-01-01T00:00:00.00Z) order by date group by csid return path, revision, author, date*}}{quote}
Will reveal "newfile.C"

But doing:
{quote}{{*select revisions where (is head on "release-1-patches" and after tag release-1-1) order by date group by csid return path, revision, author, date*}}{quote}
Will *+NOT+* reveal "newfile.C"

This is true if "newfile.C" is the initial revision. If there are subsequent revisions of "newfile.C" then it will show up in both cases.

fields.description:
We have identified and fixed a vulnerability in FishEye and Crucible that results from behaviour of certain third-party frameworks used in FishEye and Crucible. This vulnerability allows any attacker to:

* Set the FishEye and Crucible instance to allow anonymous access
* Set the FishEye and Crucible instance to allow anonymous signup

All versions of FishEye and Crucible up to and including 2.7.14 are affected by this vulnerability. The vulnerability is fixed in FishEye and/or Crucible 2.8.0 and later.

Details of this vulnerability are available in the advisory at https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/FishEye+and+Crucible+Security+Advisory+2012-08-21

and https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CRUCIBLE/FishEye+and+Crucible+Security+Advisory+2012-08-21
fields.summary: FishEye privilege escalation vulnerability

fields.description:
Configuring mod_jk with apache 2.2.22 on ubuntu 12.04 for fisheye version that have:

{noformat}
jetty-6.1.26.jar
jetty-ajp-6.1.24.jar
jetty-ajp-6.1.26.jar-COPY
jetty-util-6.1.26.jar
jsp-2.1-jetty-6.1.26.jar
{noformat}

will result in:

{noformat}
2012-08-02 10:56:22,991 ERROR [btpool0-3 ] mortbay.log Slf4jLog-warn - handle failed
java.lang.NullPointerException
at org.mortbay.jetty.ajp.Ajp13Connection$RequestHandler.parsedRequestAttribute(Ajp13Connection.java:216)
at org.mortbay.jetty.ajp.Ajp13Parser.parseNext(Ajp13Parser.java:410)
at org.mortbay.jetty.ajp.Ajp13Parser.parseAvailable(Ajp13Parser.java:151)
at org.mortbay.jetty.HttpConnection.handle(HttpConnection.java:404)
at org.mortbay.jetty.bio.SocketConnector$Connection.run(SocketConnector.java:228)
at org.mortbay.thread.BoundedThreadPool$PoolThread.run(BoundedThreadPool.java:451)
{noformat}

in the fisheye logs for any http requests made to the apache http server.

This is because version 1.2.32 of mod_jk is used.

It would work as expected with version 1.2.31 of mod_jk instead:

{noformat}
shutdown apache (/etc/init.d/apache2 stop)

 cd /usr/lib/apache2/modules/

 mv mod_jk.so mod_jk.so-1.2.32

Download mod_jk-1.2.31-httpd-2.2.x.so from http://archive.apache.org/dist/tomcat/tomcat-connectors/jk/binaries/linux/jk-1.2.31/

and rename it to mod_jk.so. Then move this to /usr/lib/apache2/modules/

Start apache (/etc/init.d/apache2 start)
{noformat}
fields.summary: mod_jk 1.2.32 does not work with jetty 6.1.26

fields.description:
Currently, Fisheye recognizes only the default JIRA ID pattern: PROJ-NUMBER

However, if other Bug Trackers (not JIRA) were being used before and the tickets are then migrated to JIRA, and they had a different pattern (ie. issueid#NUMBER), the new JIRA issue pattern is not mapped to the old pattern to allow the ticket details to be displayed in the Source tab.

* OLD Pattern in the commit message: *issueid#NUMBER*
* NEW Pattern recognized by the JIRA-Fisheye Plugin: *PROJ-NUMBER*

In the majority of the cases, updating the commit messages to the new format is not an option.

*Workaround:* the only current workaround is to change the commit messages so that they can have the supported pattern.
fields.summary: Allow Fisheye to Convert/Recognize different ticket IDs formats from commit messages

fields.summary: Fisheye fails to start if the FISHEYE_INST does not contain a config.xml

fields.description:
If a Unicode end of line character appears in a commit message (i.e.     U+2028, U+2029 or U+0085) the state machine which parses the output of 'git whatchanged' gets confused.

A typical log message is:
{noformat}
2012-06-04 09:42:40,089 ERROR - Unexpected commit statement C:1cc26fc19e8efd2875b0337592c3cf8ce786384c while in state HEADER, existing commit 4f9e156f645ef9983c380299a8714bbbba8b76cb
{noformat}

The fix is to recognise Unicode end of line characters while scanning git output.

This might also affect hg repos, but this is unknown. The fix to this issue will ensure that hg is not affected.
fields.summary: Non-ASCII end of line characters in commit messages break git scanning (JVM 1.7 fixes)

fields.description:

The EyeQL that corresponds to my search is:

select revisions from dir "/" where (is head and content matches "\"blah\"") order by date  desc  group by changeset return path, revision, author, date, csid

Regardless, I still get all matches of files which do not have the quotes ...

(See also short discussion on Atlassian Answers [here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/68258/fisheye-search-for-quoted-string-in-content])
fields.summary: Cannot search for quoted string in content (quotes are ignored)
